intro: Diodia bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá diodia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and grasslands. Diodia bogotensis is often found in elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters above sea level.
